intro: Cyrtandropsis congesta, commonly known as the Cape York hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, wiry growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal regions. Cyrtandropsis congesta is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
